title: Swiss 721 Cn BT
content:
Hi, Typophile!

I'm updating a Flash file for a customer, but I don't have the font file. The font's name is Swiss 721 Cn BT, but what does Cn and BT stand for? I figure Cn means condensed, but BT? Could someone help me out with this, or even better... point me to the correct font on MyFonts? I'd love to buy it. :-)

Thanks.
author: Beltebil

comments.content:
BT stands for Bitstream, the company that runs MyFonts.  
Should be no prob searching for Swiss 721 at MF.
Thanks, Jan. Found it prior to your post, but was a little unsure on the BT acronym. Thought it might have been a font term that I didn't know. But again. Thanks. :-)

The All-Embracing List of Typographic Abbreviations:  
 [http://www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=354](http://web.archive.org/web/20111004074606/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=354 "http://www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=354")
@Florian Hardwig - And that link just became a favorite bookmark. Thanks. :)
You’re welcome – you should thank Yves who took the effort to compile that list.
